meanings.definition: An imitation of the style of a particular writer, artist, or genre with deliberate exaggeration for comic effect.
meanings.sent1: The parody of the famous author's writing made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent2: The comedy show included a hilarious parody of a popular movie scene.
meanings.sent3: The students created a parody of Shakespeare's play for their school project.
meanings.sent4: Her exaggerated parody of the fashion industry was both funny and thought-provoking.
meanings.sent5: The parody of the politician's speech was so accurate, it became a viral sensation.

meanings.definition: A humorous or satirical imitation of a serious piece of literature or art.
meanings.sent1: The parody of the classic novel added a comedic twist to the story.
meanings.sent2: The comedian's performance was a brilliant parody of a famous painting.
meanings.sent3: The parody of the museum exhibit had visitors chuckling at the clever humor.
meanings.sent4: Her satirical parody of the art world's pretentiousness was both clever and entertaining.
meanings.sent5: The parody of the opera singer's performance was both funny and surprisingly accurate.

meanings.definition: To produce a humorous imitation of (a writer, artist, or genre).
meanings.sent1: She decided to parody the famous singer's latest hit song.
meanings.sent2: The comedy group loves to parody popular TV shows in their sketches.
meanings.sent3: He tried to parody the famous painter's style but ended up creating his own unique art.
meanings.sent4: The comedian's ability to parody celebrities always leaves the audience in stitches.
meanings.sent5: The students planned to parody the school principal in their upcoming play.
